channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: Countdown to Hiroshima: Daily blog posts recount the final weeks and days of thought and action leading to the two atomic bombings, including the morally dubious political games being played in Washington. https://t.co/bTfLc5OTUc
item.source:markdown: Countdown to Hiroshima: Daily blog posts recount the final weeks and days of thought and action leading to the two atomic bombings, including the morally dubious political games being played in Washington. https://t.co/bTfLc5OTUc

item.description: "There is an urgent need for Americans to look deeply into themselves and their actions, and musical poetry is perhaps the most effective mirror available. Every newspaper headline is a potential song." --Phil Ochs https://t.co/Chhpw6DPMU
item.source:markdown: "There is an urgent need for Americans to look deeply into themselves and their actions, and musical poetry is perhaps the most effective mirror available. Every newspaper headline is a potential song." --Phil Ochs https://t.co/Chhpw6DPMU

item.description: "American poets are unaware of their own complicity in the dispensation and appropriation of acceptable bodies. I’m no longer spending my money where I have to rattle the doors to get in." https://t.co/RCFBitNU6G
item.source:markdown: "American poets are unaware of their own complicity in the dispensation and appropriation of acceptable bodies. I’m no longer spending my money where I have to rattle the doors to get in." https://t.co/RCFBitNU6G

item.description: Rhythm N Roots streams 9 to noon (Central) weekday mornings on KXCV-KRNW. Songs I never hear around northern Indiana. Some Zydeco, Cajun, hip Country, and I don't know what all. https://t.co/0j4GptqZaF
item.source:markdown: Rhythm N Roots streams 9 to noon (Central) weekday mornings on KXCV-KRNW. Songs I never hear around northern Indiana. Some Zydeco, Cajun, hip Country, and I don't know what all. https://t.co/0j4GptqZaF

item.description: "When you look back, his message was so humanistic, how could it possibly have seemed so radical? He was singing for equality and freedom and the end of war." --Michael Schumacher recalling Phil Ochs https://t.co/Chhpw6DPMU
item.source:markdown: "When you look back, his message was so humanistic, how could it possibly have seemed so radical? He was singing for equality and freedom and the end of war." --Michael Schumacher recalling Phil Ochs https://t.co/Chhpw6DPMU

item.description: Too much writing about rural life is done by someone standing on the far side of a five bar gate, said someone like Orwell. The principle applies widely.
item.source:markdown: Too much writing about rural life is done by someone standing on the far side of a five bar gate, said someone like Orwell. The principle applies widely.
